Mané on the TV series' he enjoys: “I love Power, I love Arrow also, and I love Game of Thrones."

Mané's chef: “He loves fish. There is no fast food and no cutting corners. His favourite food is salmon, actually.”

Mané on what he does on a Saturday if Liverpool aren't playing: “I watch football because I don’t know how to play the PlayStation! I’ve never tried. Sometimes I play ping-pong with my friends at home, or my chef.”

No Mané, no problem as Klopp builds Liverpool's revival on strong foundations, writes @JamesPearceEcho

For all the talk of defensive frailties, Liverpool haven’t conceded a goal from open play since Willian’s fluke for Chelsea nearly a month ago. That’s more than nine hours of football. (James Pearce)

There have been wobbles along the way but this season is built on much stronger foundations. Liverpool are inside the top four of the Premier League and in the last 16 of the Champions League. (James Pearce)

Buy a centre-back in January and this squad will be sufficiently packed to last the pace. (James Pearce)

John Terry has revealed why it was a “nightmare” playing at Anfield – but admits the Champions League semi-final of 2005 was the best atmosphere he has ever played in. (@LivEchoLFC)

Terry: “Going to Anfield was horrible. The atmosphere: you would drive from the hotel, a 30-minute bus ride and they were all on the streets, winding you up, throwing stuff at the bus.”

Terry: “You look forward to going there, you look forward to the big games and big nights. The Champions League game in 2005 is probably the best atmosphere I've ever played in.”
